entry.title: Generating Real-Time Audio Sentiment Analysis With AI
entry.summary: In this article, Joas Pambou builds the tool to provide a sentiment score in **real-time** with enhanced user experience by providing multilingual support. You will use an OpenAI library called Whisper that transcribes audio files into text and detects the language, and Gradio, a UI framework, to establish the interface.

entry.title: Podcast: Automate Your Job Then Keep Climbing with Malindi Colyer
entry.summary: Today I'm joined by Malindi Colyer. Among her many skills, she's a Python developer and AI engineer. Malindi grew up on a farm in rural Kansas, in the middle of the US. She trained to become a diplomat, and volunteered overseas. But along the way, she discovered a love of

entry.title: How to Choose a Deployment Strategy for Your Next.js Application
entry.summary: Many projects are migrating from React to Next.js in 2023. So now's the right time to understand an important step in creating a Next.js application: deployment. entry.summary: Web security is an important aspect of the web application development process. Especially as more data is stored, managed, and shared. As a web developer, it's essential to prioritize security measures to protect your companyâ€™s users and data from potential threats. In this article, I will demonstrate web

entry.title: The AI and Cybersecurity Handbook â€“ Past the Hype and Onto the ROI
entry.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) has become one of the most talked about technologies in cybersecurity. Driven by the rising sophistication of cyber threats and large talent shortages, organizations are turning to AI as a force multiplier for security teams. But integrating AI into security workflows requires thoughtful planning and evaluation.

entry.title: JavaScript Array Handbook â€“ Learn How JS Array Methods Work With Examples and Cheat Sheet
entry.summary: In programming, an array is a data structure that contains a collection of elements. Arrays are very useful because you can store, access, and manipulate multiple elements in a single array. In this handbook, you'll learn how to work with arrays in JavaScript. We'll cover the specific rules you need

entry.title: A September Of Never Ending Adventures (2023 Wallpapers Edition)
entry.summary: Letâ€™s get ready for September with some fresh wallpaper designs! Created with love by artists and designers from across the globe, the wallpapers in this collection come in versions with and without a calendar. Enjoy!

entry.title: How to Set Up Social Media Web Authentication using Firebase
entry.summary: User authentication is extremely important in the context of web development. The way users log in affects their overall experience and engagement with an application. It also affects how they initially perceive it. Authentication techniques are continually evolving as social media sites continue to grow in popularity. The ability to

entry.title: OWASP API Security Top 10 â€“ Secure Your APIs
entry.summary: The OWASP API Security Top 10 is a standard reference guide highlighting the most critical web API vulnerabilities to help developers and organizations understand and mitigate potential security threats. We just published a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you about each security risk and techniques to

entry.title: How to Build an Online Image-to-PDF Converter with HTML, CSS, JS, and NodeJS
entry.summary: An online image-to-PDF converter is a website that helps you convert your images to PDFs. This tool is useful because it provides an efficient way to store your images. In this tutorial, you'll learn how you can create your online image-to-pdf converter with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and NodeJS. Table of

entry.title: Falling For Oklch: A Love Story Of Color Spaces, Gamuts, And CSS
entry.summary: The CSS Color Module Level 4 specification defined a slew of new color features when it became a candidate recommendation in 2022, including Oklab and Oklch, which have widened the field of color we have to work with. Explore the Oklch color space and how to start using it in CSS today.

entry.title: Improving The Double Diamond Design Process
entry.summary: The so-called â€œDouble Diamondâ€ is a great way of visualizing an ideal design process â€” but itâ€™s just not the way most companies deliver new projects or services. Andy Budd proposes a new â€œDouble Diamondâ€ idea that better aligns with the way work actually gets done and highlights the place where design has the most leverage.

entry.title: A Few Interesting Ways To Use CSS Shadows For More Than Depth
entry.summary: We often think of shadows in CSS as something to reach for when we want to add depth to a design. But shadows can be used for more than depth. Letâ€™s experiment with different shadows â€” two CSS properties and a filter â€” to make interesting hover effects, different text styles, and even casting shadows on other shadows.

entry.title: Better Context Menus With Safe Triangles
entry.summary: Discover how to improve the user experience of nested menus and tackle a minor yet common issue with them when the userâ€™s pointer leaves the menu item for a moment, and the nested menu goes away, requiring the user to re-hover and try again. A well-known concept called the â€œsafe triangleâ€ solves this problem.

entry.title: Modern Methods For Improving Drupalâ€™s Largest Contentful Paint Core Web Vital
entry.summary: The background image used in the hero component, which is slow to load, is a very common problem with any component that uses a large image file as a background image. In this article, Mike Herchel walks you through how to tackle this common performance issue using modern techniques.

entry.title: Knip: An Automated Tool For Finding Unused Files, Exports, And Dependencies
entry.summary: Most of the projects have at least a few unused files, exports, and dependencies lying around, often because itâ€™s difficult knowing when one thing relies on another and scary removing something youâ€™re not sure is in use. Lars Kappert shares a tool heâ€™s been working on that offers a solution.

entry.title: Designing Accessible Text Over Images: Best Practices, Techniques And Resources (Part 2)
entry.summary: In part 2 of the series, Hannah Milan reviews various accessible text over images techniques for designing your content, including framing the image, soft-colored gradients technique, text styles and text position, solid color shapes, and use of colored backgrounds.

entry.title: Running A Page Speed Test: Monitoring vs. Measuring
entry.summary: What does your performance â€œstackâ€ look like? There are all kinds of tools available for measuring page speed, but what data and assumptions do they use to measure performance? And speaking of *measuring* performance, thereâ€™s quite a difference between that and *monitoring* performance. Letâ€™s dig in!

entry.title: Using Friction As A Feature In Machine Learning Algorithms
entry.summary: Friction often has a negative connotation in user experience design, but it actually has many benefits. Its best-known use case is mitigating unintended consequences in high-risk scenarios, yet it has a new place in the age of artificial intelligence. Adding strategic friction to interfaces can lead to profound efficiency gains in machine learning algorithms.
